Articles.Content:
What the title says, for a few days, KSP has been crashing at different times: Before it goes to the title screen, before launching a craft, or just right away. After checking the crash logs, there were only 2 folders with all 3 files.

Here's the error, Player, and the Crash.dmp. This is happening on both copies of KSP, one that will always update, and the other that I'm using for the Beyond Home race.

Did you see this in the player file?

  

TexturesUnlimited - Loading Shader Pack: TU-Shaders :: C:/Program Files (x86)/Steam/steamapps/common/Kerbal Space Program/KSP_x64_Data/../GameData/000_TexturesUnlimited/Shaders/tushaders-transparent.ssf
 
(Filename: C:\buildslave\unity\build\Runtime/Export/Debug/Debug.bindings.h Line: 35)

TexturesUnlimited - Loaded Shader: TU/Transparent/Legacy :: assets/shaders/surface/tu-transparent-legacy.shader from pack: TU-Shaders
 
(Filename: C:\buildslave\unity\build\Runtime/Export/Debug/Debug.bindings.h Line: 35)

DynamicHeapAllocator allocation probe 1 failed - Could not get memory for large allocation 7700804.
DynamicHeapAllocator allocation probe 2 failed - Could not get memory for large allocation 7700804.
DynamicHeapAllocator allocation probe 3 failed - Could not get memory for large allocation 7700804.
DynamicHeapAllocator allocation probe 4 failed - Could not get memory for large allocation 7700804.
DynamicHeapAllocator out of memory - Could not get memory for large allocation 7700804!

 

In addition, the logs seems to suggest you have 8 GB of memory and Intel HD as the graphics card - which uses system memory. Depending on what else is running on your machine you might simply be running out of memory. Anything with "textures" in it sounds memory intensive to me.

Edited November 13, 2020 by Kerbart
Okay, I'm not at my computer right now, but I'll try that out later today.
Okay, just done that, and it didn't work.  This time the files were there. And the link to them is https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1oO2PgsRtb5cZ8MUT1HpeoXlvcBqPtRw6?usp=sharing.

Okay, now my usual save is working, but my Beyond Home isn't and that's the priority.

Link to error.log, that's the only one I have. https://drive.google.com/file/d/15vTODTFymDWKRCfLHkVLPqgUp2dmbm1R/view?usp=sharing

Okay, now it's evolved into breakpoints, the usual is now letting me launch stuff from the VAB and Launchpad, but not from the SPH or Runway. And the Beyond Home save stops before it reaches the title screen. Here's the new crash report. https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1NBqDCkecN0MbybAhui8rGFTRuT1uwfEd?usp=sharing
Have you tried updating your graphics drivers? The last time I saw errors like that was due to an outdated graphics driver, updating it solved the issue.

3 hours ago, jimmymcgoochie said:

Have you tried updating your graphics drivers? The last time I saw errors like that was due to an outdated graphics driver, updating it solved the issue.

Intel says I do.

On 11/13/2020 at 6:45 AM, GuessingEveryDay said:

What the title says, for a few days, KSP has been crashing at different times: Before it goes to the title screen, before launching a craft, or just right away. After checking the crash logs, there were only 2 folders with all 3 files.

Here's the error, Player, and the Crash.dmp. This is happening on both copies of KSP, one that will always update, and the other that I'm using for the Beyond Home race.

Eay fix, delete your mods, then the game, backup the BHR file, and reinstall.

Okay, that isn't working. it worked for one launch in the stock system save, then crashed, and the BH save didn't even open. And the folders for the crash reports aren't there. There's only the crash.dmp... I was hoping to give you your first solve.

Edited November 19, 2020 by GuessingEveryDay
Just noticed.
